name: Michael K
text: Came here for family vacation and had a blast. This was our second escape room ever and our first with escapology. We did the Budapest express and managed to complete it in time! Nick and Alexis were our Game host and Game master. They were super friendly and helpful. The props and room were a much  better quality to the first escape room we did. Overall really made me and my family a lot more interested in doing escape rooms again! Thank you for a wonderful day!

resp.text:
Hi Michael K!
Thank you so much for the glowing review! We're glad you enjoyed our Escapology Budapest Express! We're so happy to have you as a Stars and Striker!
We hope to see you again soon :)
The Stars & Strikes Team

name: Timothy Mayer
text: The room was really cheesy and the final solution was unlocked when we entered the last room. The game master had to pause the game and reset the room. Also, the game master admitted that this happens all the time with the locks so I wouldn't expect much regarding the quality of the other two rooms. Don't waste your money.

resp.text:
Hi Timothy,
We're so sorry you had this experience and thank you for the valuable feedback. We would love to put you in touch with the location manager to make this right if you'd like to provide your contact information. We would like to contact you directly to resolve this matter.
Sincerely,
The Stars & Strikes Team

name: Ian Bumpas
text: It was super fun!!! Would definitely recommend

name: Patricia Rodriguez
text: We did the Las Vegas location in Oct 2019 and had so much fun we went again before our trip was over. What a great place. There was only 3 of us and we got the room to ourselves. It was fabulous. So professional and friendly. I would recommend Escapeologoly to everyone! Can't wait for our 2020 visit! We will definitely book another game!

name: Catherine McLeod
text: We completed the Budapest Express escape room and on the whole it was a well put together room.  There was a good flow and good themes to the clues. I did have a couple of issues though.  The first issue I had was that the game host was overseeing multiple games at once so when requesting clues there was a bit of a delay and sometimes we had to request twice.  Secondly, the previous game had not been fully cleaned as a dry erase board found towards the end of the game still had answers on it from the previous group. We confirmed with the game master it was in error and erased it ourselves to keep the spirit of the game but it was a bit unfortunate.  I would return to try the other rooms if again in the area.

name: Thaddeus Mattox
text: Had a great time! Rumi did an amazing job assisting us through the andidote challenge. Pretty nerve racking, but an overall adventure. Great!

name: Nesha Tucker
text: Definitely a must try !!  Nice decor and staff was very nice and welcoming! Antidote room was fun !!!!

name: E Schwartz
text: Worst escape room experience ever. They have pre typed clues they use even if you have already solved those clues. Game master is watching over 2 rooms so has no idea where you are at in your room. Having preset clues is a horrible idea as people think and see differently. I have been to over 40 rooms in numerous states and this is the first room I walked out of. I can recommend 20 plus rooms far superior to these poorly ran rooms. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE GO TO HUNTSVILE ESCAPE ROOMS FOR A FAR SUPERIOR EXPERIENCE.

name: Katt Bryant
text: Loved it!!!!! Will be doing it again soon!!!

name: Amy Tadlock
text: Great for a child birthday party. Limited choice on the different jumps but great for children.

name: Jay Friday
text: Jumps A Lot is awesome!  I had my daughters 6th birthday party there. We have been to all the bounce houses in the area and Jumps A Lot is by far the best. The inflatables are better than any other around and all the kids loved it!  Some of the other parents commented on how clean the inflatables were. The staff did a great job and most important all the kids had a blast.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

name: Brianna Payne
text: I ordered an inflatable for my son's 5th birthday party! There was a slight mix up, but the manager resolved it in what has to be record time! The gentleman who delivered the jump was so nice and accomaditing to make sure I pleased and everything was good to go! Not only that, but the inflatable was CLEAN! Having ordered 2 before from a different company, I expected the normal sweeping and need for a wipe down, but this one needed nothing! I FULLY recommend Jumps-A-Lot, their equipment, and their staff to anyone searching to rent an inflatable for a party! For anyone wondering, we used the 5-in-1 Combo and it is AWESOME!

name: Kathryn Lee
text: Fun for the kids most games did not work and the 2 helpers did not seem to happy to help and didn't get mich help from them

name: Jennifer Williams
text: Fun but a lot of the games were out of order

name: Kenneth Concilio
text: My daughter loves the place!

name: AleishaDavisDesigns TheSableBelle
text: Great location for parties!

name: Crystal Mcdaneld
text: More then half the games didn't work and the ones that did took your money

name: Scott Dillard
text: Great meeting space.

name: Jeremy Mayfield
text: I would come here again and again! If anyone visits ask for Mateo! Great one on one instruction. The prices were reasonable and the service was great!

name: MyFathers TwoAcres
text: This was a lot of fun. Went for the first time last night at a different place and came to this place tonight.  This place had a lot more lanes to chunk axes down but it also had a lot more noise with the go cart speedway inside. They looked fun as well but we just did the axe throw. Little bit on the expensive side of things.  Still had a great time. Learned more about throwing and some more games to play.

name: Cody LeBouef
text: Had a very nice time with the family racing and then throwing axes. Mateo was our coach, and he was very friendly and informative! Great experience overall

name: Mariah Carrie
text: Very fun experience. Went on a couple date night! Zane was an excellent coach ! I will definitely go back again ! :)

name: Mike Patterson
text: We went for a Father’s Day outing not knowing what to expect. It was so much fun!! Everyone there was so nice and helpful and our coach Shawn was the best instructor!! He was like part of the family by the time we left. We will definitely be back!!

name: Josh Head
text: I can’t say enough positive things about this place. We had a blast here and our throwing instructor Kyle was the best! He was a awesome guy that put up with six of us and to say he was great is an understatement. I’m definitely coming back here with my family.

name: Anna Volz
text: We celebrated my birthday with Axe throwing at the Autobahn Speedway. Due to a glitch with their wood, it took them a lot longer to get us back there than anticipated, but it was SO worth it! Our master axe thrower, Shawn, made the entire night fun! He was a great instructor and helped us have a truly memorable experience!

name: Emily Johnson-Peyton
text: Autobahn is a great place. Myself and 3 others enjoyed our axe throwing experience so much, and they also cart raced which they said they really enjoyed. We are not from Birmingham we were just visiting and we were very pleased with our visit. Sadly I can't remember our coaches for axe throwing but they were both great and gave us our space to enjoy ourselves. Sorry I can't remember their names but we came in on Sunday 9/1 if that helps. If we are ever in Bham again we will most certainly come back!

resp.text:
Thank you Emily! We enjoyed reading your review, we felt good knowing we provided you a wonderful experience with the axe throwing and the cart racing! Thank you for your kind words to our coaches, everyone works hard at giving customers like yourself the best time!

Yes, if you're ever in Birmingham again, our doors are wide open for you! Thank you for the FIVE STAR REVIEW!!

Courtney Jones
Customer Service

name: Melissa Alexander Mays
text:
JUST DISCOVERED Fun Lab Party Place a few weeks ago. I took a 3 yr old🤔He loved it~already he's asking when we can go back to the FUN PLACE😁 its is convenient for me & in close proximity.to neighboring Walker County,AL . Entertain the kidos when weather doesn't cooperate because it's all INSIDE😊Don't stress...its a LARGE AREA so the noise of kids yelling & playing didn't bother me.  The  inflatables are NOT tiny (see my pics for actual size).and  did I mention the games? Yes games😊Don't forget buy tokens when u pay to get n& save ur tickets redeem for prizes Hungry? Thirsty? they got that too🌭🍕🍿🥤.I could not help but take note of how CLEAN this place was. The owner was friendly. Very sweet lady.  We will DEFINATELY be a regular at the Fun Lab Party Place 👨‍👦👨‍👨‍👧👪👨‍👧‍👦Bring all the kids-TAKE SHOES OFF& LET THEM HAVE SOME FUN Hope to see u there🥰

😲Rent a PARTY ROOM😁
Birthday Parties, Church Groups, Family gatherings

Thank
you so much!!

text: Nice place to take young kids. My 7yr old loves it. Friendly staff, nice clean snack bar inside. $8 to play in a building full of inflatables.

name: Amy Willnow
text: The kids really enjoyed the bouncy houses but almost half the coin games didn't work.

name: Christy Langley
text: We always have a good time at the Fun Lab!!! There is something for everyone of all age groups. The atmosphere is VERY kid friendly, they have snacks, drinks and ice cream. They also have TVs to keep you entertained. Bounce houses, games, arcades, toys, gifts, they have it all!!!! If you haven't been, you're missing out.

text: Fun place to hang out. Veterans and Senior day 2 to 5. $5. Check website. Hours change. Decent Midway. Many animals. 4H. Lots of local school displays about farming. Lady Houdini is fantastic. A full view water escape. Do not miss. Marc as the OneManBand is very entertaining and a great warm up for Lady Houdini.

text: I got here every year and I love it I have so much fun

name: Evin Brooks
text: This place was amazing, I have a crippling fear of heights, yet enjoyed every second of it. Sadly I didn't get a chance to get on all the rides, but got on most. The Y-Factor and Starship were my favorite. On the Y-Factor my safety bar was creaky and instead of enjoying the rides, I was hanging on for fear life, hoping not to fall. Besides that, they have the best music, and the best funnel cakes. Usually I am not a fan of funnel cakes, but I enjoyed the one I had. They need to take the tickets out and you just get the stamp. Would you rather pay $200 to get on rides, or pay $20 to get on all the rides, forever. The answer presents itself. It's a great place to take your kids, and you'll probably enjoy it yourself, too. I makes me sad the fair is only open for about a week I believe. Like 5 of those days kids are in school. I think it should be open more often. But overall this place was the most funny I have had yet, this year.

text: Took grandson it wkas so much fun

text: Had a great time a Funntasia with family & friends!  I had forgotten how much fun hitting a little ball can be.  Good wholesome family fun!

name: Lisa Lane
text: We had fun, & the worker was really nice. It's just really run down, needing repairs & a serious facelift. Upon entering the parking lot, we actually thought it was closed down until we saw the open sign.

name: Julie Nager
text: A lovely, creative course that's fun for the family, but it could use some repairs. The walkways, greens, and fountains have certainly seen better days.

name: Nuke Life
text: This place has so much potential! It's just in need of a good facelift and a little spring cleaning.  The place doesn't look like much even when you pull up to a  dirty & over grown parking lot had second guesses on actually going in. The water was very dirty and quite a bit of trash, the wooden walkways needed repair and repainted, grass needed to be cut and weeded, and the turf needed to be replaced if this were to happen this would be the place to go!

name: Zombie Hunter
text: It's a shame. That is s ok rundown now. Was a great place. Waste of money now. Avoid at all costs.

name: William Morris
text: Kinda run down. But one of only a few mini golf options in town. At least this one doesn't tend to be crowded, and it's cheap.

name: Cindy Coffey
text: It was closed down!!!!

name: J.C. Blanca
text: It was like a trip back to the 90s.

name: Tam Tam & Fam
text: My family and I had a BLAST tonight here. We did the room that's called Movie Night. We cannot wait to come back and do the other rooms. It was our first time ever doing an escape room and it DID NOT disappoint. You for sure need to go there and do it. It was SO FUN!!! The owner was awesome as well. They made it a great experience.

name: Destany
text: We all had a great time figuring out the clues!

name: Jen Zuercher
text: We had a fun time doing the Insane Asylum room. Just challenging enough to be fun but not frustrating. We were the first in the room for the day. One of the clues wasn't reset correctly so the owner had to come in. That, along with being able to hear talking in the hall outside and phone calls in an office, took you out of the element a bit. Still fun, but could make some changes to improve the experience. They offered a coupon, which made the price more reasonable. Online booking and waivers were simple and convenient. Enjoyed the private room without the private room expense. Owners smoking out front comes across a bit unprofessional.

name: Alan Fogle
text: My wife, 7 year old daughter and I visited this place on Wednesday March the 31. We all had an amazing time and the staff was very friendly. It was our daughters first escape room (we did asylum) we did make it out in the time. The room was very clean and it was only us three. The staff was very helpful in hints and clues. The only thing we did not like is the ceilings did not go all the way up so you could hear people talking in other rooms but was not bad. That and the location are the only two things bad we have to say about this. The location is in a shopping center and located in a back side ally and due to regulations of the shopping center they are not allowed to advertise as they would like but definitely walk you through where they are on the phone. I highly recommend this game room. We will be back to to their other rooms. Very well priced.

name: Kristal Monahan
text: The owner operator did not explain the rules well. Not family friendly at all. Definitely not for children.  The clues were stupid. Worst $126/hr ever!!!!. Would not recommend at all. Not fun. Boring and stupid

name: LarzBuff
text:
We went for the Insane Asylum and had a great time. The clues and mechanics were well put together. This was our first escape and it was our 5th experience with an escape room, the 2nd for our 10yo son, and the first for grandpa.
The only criticisms we have is that our first clue was to something we had solved already. We tried to communicate that but there is no two-way radio in this room. Just a button to get their attention to put a clue on the screen. They did apologize and we ended up only using 2 clues.
I would recommend this company for others as we had a good experience.

name: Innovative Cleaning and Restoration
text: Really good time! The entire group had a blast. It could be a little cheaper, but overall I would recommend and do again.

name: Lindsay Y
text: Very friendly and a good set up. The whole family had fun!

name: Les Coley
text: When we first entered the owner mentioned that he had new employees working that day.  He bashed his new employees throughout the visit. The room was not set up or fully when it was time for us to start the escape.  When we asked for clues the owner yelled over the walls to give us the clue.  We could hear the owner talking to other customers as we were trying to enjoy our experience. . No ceilngs anywhere in the escape rooms.  One of the puzzels did not work properly for us and my wife mentioned it to the owner and he totally discounted her feedback.  Overall okay escape room but unprofessional ownership/management.

name: MATTMANGOLD
text: First time in an escape room, I enjoyed it, it was very challenging I hope to go back soon.

name: Susan McQueen
text: We had a great time there in early January.We did the insane asylum, and made the escape. I would highly recommend  it for good family fun.

name: Andy Titcume
text: Had a great time with CSI Gulf Shores. Highly recommend this for all ages

name: Robin Cowdrey
text: This was our families first escape room with our good friends. We chose the CSI: Gulf Shores room. It was challenging and we made it out with over seventeen minutes to spare! Our guide was great and we will definitely be back in the future.

name: Heidi Ennis
text: Our family had such an amazingly fun time at this venue.  The staff gave us some initial tips, since we were new at escape rooms.  The clues were challenging, but solvable, while the theme (insane asylum) was fun!   The staff was great, sanitary and clean venue, highly recommend this on your stay in Gulf Shores! Overall awesome experience!

name: brianna goolsby
text: My fiancé and I did two escape rooms here and loved both. The owners were very nice and friendly. One of the owners talked to us for a while outside and after one of the games. I highly recommend this place if you want very detailed and fun escape rooms. We will definitely be back!

name: Carrie Bowman
text: Our  multi-generational family of 6 did 2 rooms while in the area.  It was a great experience.  We have done several all over the USA and rate this as one of the best.

name: Eli Tipton
text: Me and my friends went here and did the CSI Miami room. It was a fun but challenging escape room. The host was very welcoming and professional. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good escape room.

name: Kim Kauffman
text: We were visiting Orange Beach for a family vacation and 13 of us decided to do the Escape Rooms.  We had a blast!  Very friendly owners and the business is clean - especially during this crazy time of Covid.  Highly recommended!  We escaped the CSI and the Insane Asylum rooms!

name: Megan Whitecotton
text: We booked The Insane Asylum one day while on vacation. We really enjoyed the layout, the challenges and the family time. However, the man who took care of us while we were there was far from welcoming. He was passively aggressive with almost everything that he said. He looked one of the older kids in the face while he was talking about the room because he wasn’t making eye contact that he needed to focus. Which I understand, but that’s also not how you talk to someone’s child. At the end after we escaped, he lined us up for a photo. One of our kids friends was not smiling to his liking and he asked her, “were you beaten when you were a child?” Which to some may not be that big of a deal, but she had in fact gone through severe mental, emotional and physical abuse when she was younger and his comment triggered her. She was also standing very close to my boyfriend, who she had never met before this trip, and we tried to move her to the other side of the photo so she’d be more comfortable and he asked one of the kids in a very rude way, “well do you want to come over here and do this then?” This establishment is obviously lacking customer service skills and that can be detrimental to a company. We enjoyed the escape room, but not the staff.

name: Sully Oliver
text: Our host was very friendly! He made sure we had all the information we needed to have an enjoyable experience. CSI: Gulf Shores was quite fun and challenging, definitely would go to XIT Escape Room again!

name: John Hurt
text: The rooms were designed very well and the puzzles were awesome! Please visit this place! You won't be disappointed.

name: Kelly Elrod
text: When we arrived two employees were to the side of the door smoking. It turns out they were the owners. Once inside we were given the "social distancing" speech which I understand due to the virus however the smell of smoke should also be a concern as many people are allergic. The Lysol they were spraying due to Covid only made the smell of smoke worse. We were asked to wash her hands prior to entering the escape room. No problem, however, no paper towels were in the restroom. The gentleman then asked his wife to bring him the paper towel holder key which she did while holding a dog. We are dog friendly people however many are not.  Once we were in the escape room you could see lights above us, hear the phone ringing, owners speaking and the answering machine as the room was not fully in closed nor soundproof. The background noise was a total downer for the overall experience.

resp.text: Kelly thank you for your comments. We have addressed each one of your complaints and have made changes to fix these problems. Everybody has that one day when things are not perfect. I wish you would have escaped so this could have been at least a little better. Thank you.

name: William Hagan
text: Our group of 5 enjoyed it very much and the owners were great! Highly recommend. Will have to plan another trip soon.

resp.text: Thank you for the compliment. We look forward to seeing you again.

name: Mr. Wolf
text: Really fun time! Even though we didn't make it out in time we really enjoyed ourselves. Very modern room with a video screen for the hints. The puzzles we were trying to solve were pretty hard, but we should have been able to solve them! The manager of the place was very nice and tried his best to help us along, but we were a lost cause! The price is in line with other escape rooms, but he did offer us a coupon. Overall a great experience!

name: Tiffany Kidd
text: Meh. It was ok. Not great but not horrible. There was no real logic in finding the next clue. Would do any other escape room in the area before going back to this one. The owner seemed annoyed that we were there. But we had fun as a family! Not sure if it was $150 worth of fun but whatever.

name: Brenden Coulter
text: Workers were very nice and the rooms were very clever and fun.  They gave plenty of hints to keep the room interesting and did their best to un-stump us when we were stumped.  Great experience.

resp.text: Thank you for the compliment. We look forward to seeing you again.

name: Trey heliin
text: Super friendly workers who help very well. Rooms were super cool with lots of interesting twists and turns, very modern. Would 10/10 recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for the compliment. We look forward to seeing you again.

resp.text: Thank you for the compliment. We look forward to seeing you again.

name: Kem Verner
text: Our family of 13 had the best time. We split into 2 separate groups to solve 2 different rooms. The games/puzzles where challenging and relevant to the theme. Thank you X-It for fun family centered entertainment.  CSI & Tale of Two Forts

name: Tyler Barnes
text: Overall a great experience. We did the Tale of Two Forts and had a really fun time with the experience. It’s a totally custom experience with some fun Orange Beach history mixed in. The management team is lots of fun and very nice. Highly recommend.

name: Holly Rutherford
text: We walked in super late and these guys welcome us on in! Super nice people and tons of FUN! GREAT PLACE !! Highly recommended. Worth the money! WE ESCAPED 😁

name: Kris Horman
text: These guys do an AMAZING job with their escape rooms! Really thrilled with the puzzles and the workers there! Excited to see what their scary movie room will hold in store for us!

name: Christian Rogers
text: Host was awesome. It was a great time.

name: Rickey Burgess
text: It was a great place. James was great I would recommend this place to anyone. It was our first time doing it and we did the fort one. We did escape.

resp.text: Thank you for the compliment. We look forward to seeing you again.

name: Jean Wagner
text: Well done escape room! Was impressed that the owners actually wrote all the scenarios themselves! They were unique and had a lot of different kinds of puzzles for all skill levels and ages! Lots of fun and you can tell the owners really work hard to make sure each customer has a good time! Will definitely be back!

name: Kissie Talbot
text: Drove 30 plus minutes just to realize it’s closed. Website says it’s open. Pretty disappointed.

name: Sidney Priest
text: This was my first time doing an escape room, and I’m glad it was here. The staff was informative and friendly. It was a blast solving the clues in order to escape the room. My family and I thoughouly enjoyed the it and would highly recommend to anyone!

name: Ejwows
text: Excellent. Had a blast. Staff was great. Room was really cool not too difficult but difficult enough to make you feel like you got your money's worth. Definitely recommend this escape room.

name: gary murphree
text:
Had a blast
Lady so helpful

name: Joanna Rouse
text: We had a great time !! Great customer service and reasonably priced  . They offer a coupon online . We will definitely do this again 😊

name: Grant Robicheaux
text:
Most of the escape room was designed very well. They gave us a clue, without my group asking for one. The clue given wasnt very clear, and when we followed it and got out of the room, we were told we failed because we "cheated" because we missed a step. The man was very rude to us and couldn't have cared less when we explained we were following the unwated and unclear clue we were given. Would not return because of the ridiculous procedure and terrible attitude of the employee.
Edit: the employee we interacted with was a white male, late 20s early 30s, glasses and with a beard.
Edit #2. The owner called, and apologized for the service of the crew there, and refunded half of our purchase.

name: Madison Lee
text: We did the Tale Of Two Forts with 7 people. I was super impressed that the owners come up with all the rooms themselves! The place was very clean & the staff was wonderful. Will definitely be back!!

name: Joanna Rouse
text: We had a great time !! Great customer service and reasonably priced  . They offer a coupon online . We will definitely do this again 😊

name: Belinda Berka
text: The owner was so rude. Would never go again or recommend.   He tried to apologize at the end.  Said he had had a stressful day.    There were 6 of us at $25.00 each.   Terrible waste of money.

name: Blake Will
text: Great time! Recommend for anyone in gulf shores to check this out!

name: Shannon Johnson
text: Great experience.

name: Evan Brechting
text: Great rooms, prices, and staff

resp.text: Thank you for the compliment. We look forward to seeing you again.

name: Jahna NaY-NaY
text: We had a blast! Me & my husband did this with our oldest son and his girlfriend and we all loved it!  And yes, we escaped!

name: Justin Lovvorn
text: First time in an escape room, our family really enjoyed it. We have 3 kids 7-11 and all were able to participate and wanted to go back soon.

name: Kat Sims
text: The Alice in Wonderland Room is wonderfully decorated, and some of the objects personally made by the owner (GREAT JOB!) This escape room was a big challenge for our family! It brought home in a fun way how bad our communication is: assuming, not listening, or paying attention to detail! The teamwork was great though, passing off jobs to the people with those skills! Everyone had their own ideas who was right in the funniest, craziest ways! We didn't make it in time, but had a blast and a lot of giggles getting there! Recommend going to the bathroom first in case the group won't let you use the walkie talkie to get out, suspecting you of asking for hints, lol!!! The attendant was amazing, fulll of humor, PATIENCE, and helpfulness!!! Although she did not lock the rest of the family in there forever as I requested, for delaying my escape to the bathroom, lol!!!

name: Ken Jones
text: Had a great time! Very nice place and the pizzles were well done and complete.

name: Larry Wise
text: Went with the in-laws, and our 21 year old son. A lot of fun for ages 21-77!

resp.text: Thank you for your review of XIT Escape Room. It was our pleasure to have you visit us.

text: A bit pricey, but an excellent and challenging game! We did CSI: Gulf Shores.

name: Morgan Davis
text: Had lots of fun.

name: James S
text: We almost made it through the asylum! That was fun definitely coming back!

resp.text: Thank you for you kind words. We look forward to having you back.

name: Cory Stoll
text: This was our second experience with an escape room, the first having been The Captured in Gatlinburg, Tn. We had nothing but rave reviews with The Captured. Kendalyn is correct, the rooms were small and cramped. There were only a total of approx 10 puzzles to figure out in the entire experience of The Insane Asylum at Xit. The walls of the rooms don't extend to the ceiling so you don't even really feel like you are in a room. FOR SURE there is no spooky element. The puzzles were abstract and did not flow. There may be people who would enjoy this kind of thing but our group of 10 did not. Honestly, I would suggest trying your luck at one of the other escape rooms offered in Gulf Shores as they are at least less expensive though I can not say if they are great or not since we have not tried those yet. Furthermore, after my 14 yr old daughter left her honest opinion while remaining polite, the owner James messaged her privately on FB and asked her to remove her review and told her he could sue her. He also privately messaged me and asked me to tell her to take it down. VERY unprofessional.

text: I just finished the 6-week Intro to Wheel class with Ian yesterday. It was honestly the best money I've spent in years. Ian was really patient and empathetic, and the experience of learning how to make cups and bowls was awesome. I've already signed up to do the class again and can't wait to come back.

resp.text: I'm not sure you meant to review our company. We are an Escape Room.

name: Lela Manis
text: We came and visited after grabbing ice cream next door, we weren't intending to do any escape room at all, but we ended up doing all four rooms in two days. The staff (especially Miranda and DJ) was incredibly nice and we would recommend this place to anyone stopping by.

name: Sarai Newman
text: It was fun and a nice place. Only thing is, our room was rated 8/10 scary and absolutely nothing was scary about it. Nothing looked real enough to be scary. But the staff was helpful and it was a fun thing to do to tie off our evening.

name: peyton hodges
text: Had lots of fun with my group in the Voodoo Cabin room and found it a bit more difficult than originally expected. If you enjoy escape rooms and are experienced with them like me then definitely give them a visit.

name: Amy Ervin
text: This is so much fun and I encourage any family to take the challenge.  It is a great opportunity for family teamwork and promotes critical thinking on a group level.

name: jarrod street
text: This was my first escape room experience and it was for a birthday gift. The rooms seem a little small we squeezed 8 people into the voo doo room.  There was room to move but not by much.  The location is good to kill a 2 hour wait at the restaurant next door.  With everything in one location it is very easy to just walk from restaurant to here. Staff were polite teenagers. I feel that were too many rules on things not to touch in the rooms

name: Beau Brannon
text: When we walked in, there was no one at the desk for several minutes. Poor communication on rules of the room until after we escaped and were rudely told we technically were disqualified and could take a picture with the failed sign. We declined. Will not return. Customer satisfaction not top priority.

name: jeremy emerson
text: Just finished the Alice and The white rabbit room. It was awesome! Great theme, well done, and challenging. Great staff, and helpful when we needed it. Recommend for a family trip!

name: Mary Rice
text:
Doll House was a great disappointment. Finding keys among dolls and being told not to touch dolls is a poor start to an escape room. It was also very unsafe as some of the screws used to attach the dolls are poking out, and there is a chance you will get cut. No electronic screens or communication with the game master, they have to come into the room. Also, the obsession and threatening attitude about cell phones and smart watches was a turn off and over the top. Love to do escape rooms but will not be back to this one.

1 star too generous.

name: Marcus Wilson
text: Words can't begin to describe how much fun my wife and I had here. It's our 1st year anniversary and we wanted to try something new. The service was amazing and the games were a lot of fun. I'd highly recommend this place to everyone

name: Cassi Houser
text: My daughter (13) and her friend and I just did the Mystro room! It was hard! We got about halfway through it! Was a blast for all three of us! I can't wait to do another one! Awesome experience! Staff was amazing too!

name: Josh Moore
text: The staff was nice and very helpful. The "Bates Motel" escape we did was a lot of fun.

name: Julie Haller
text: This place was so much fun for our whole family, teens and adults. We all worked together and each of us contributed to finding clues that lead to our escape! I'd love to try every themed room and will definitely go back here again!

name: Sandy Kasprzak
text: The young lady working there was very nice and professional.  With that said the rest of the experience was terrible.  Only two working black lights and no real flash light except the red light on the ceiling.  Markings on items were sloppily written to the point it was hard to read them.  Colored items were very, very hard to determine with the mini black light.  I believe with some minor upgrades to the clues it could have been a much better experience.  Also, someone needs to clean the restroom-foul stains and spots on the seat and in the toilet.

resp.text:
The bathrooms and the equipment used for the rooms are supposed to be maintained by the workers. Thank you for letting me know and these problems will get handled immediately.

Owner

name: Paul Gullette
text: We really enjoyed this escape room. The price was pretty reasonable, and the two rooms we did were really fun. Only complaint we had was one of the rooms used lack of lighting as one of the difficult aspects which wasn't helped by underpowered and malfunctioning flashlights.

name: Connor Scott
text: DONT GO FOR YOUR OWN SAKE! Poorly maintained and the clues were almost unreadable. The locks in the room were difficult to open (even with the correct combination). The staff was annoyingly unhelpful. Save your money!

name: Martha Jordan
text: This was my first escape room experience. The staff seemed really harried whenever we asked for help, maybe they are understaffed? The room wasn’t scary at all, there was no ambiance. The puzzles were slightly difficult, but the experience was very frustrating due to being in a red lit room. A lot of the puzzles were based on color which only works if you can tell what color something is. The props were kind of grimy and it seemed like the room had a lot of turnover without a lot of oversight. For over $30 a person, you’d have a lot more fun putting a tent together in a dark closet. The staff were all nice and helpful, but the design is terrible.

name: Dan Savela
text: Was rather underwhelmed by the voodoo room. A lot of things broken around the room, including some of the props we were supposed to use. Without giving anything away there was something that all of our party members were using at the very beginning and I think 4 of the 6 were broken. It seemed as if there were boxes on the walls that had been ripped down at one point and now there were screws poking out of the wall, which was pretty dangerous. Our flashlights didn’t work and we were given black lights as replacements which made it very difficult to do color based puzzles. Puzzles were pretty basic, the most high tech things were flashlights, but the room design was pretty neat. Wish it was a little more spooky, maybe some jump scares or something, and the end of the game was very anticlimactic. Staff were friendly though and accommodating.

name: Matt King
text: I have done 2 rooms and both times they were fun and challenging. The staff seems to genuinely love their job so much that I think they would be happy to be paid in escape room time.

name: Nicolas Williams
text: I have done two rooms here, the zombie and doll. The zombie room was in poor condition having clues that were unreadable and broken equipment (such as broken glass microscope slides that you can easily cut yourself on). Would not recommend. The doll room was definitely creepy, but the "theme" that some clues related to no longer existed which made the experience lacking. I was hoping that a place that receives so much business such as this would have a top notch experience, but it's clear that they don't care to maintain or improve thier facility as long as people are still willing to pay for mediocrity.

resp.text:
You need to pay for your slot, you cant just "hey , I might have 7 people coming later" ,if you tried to do that at a movie and the movie sold out, you wouldn't get to see the movie! We were even nice enough to stay open late and let you do a room then but refused. By having three of your family members give us bad reviews because you did not pay for those seats is ridiculous. We tried to open another room up for you guys and you refused.

This was so another person with Brittany Owens's group.

name: Justin Davis
text: We had a fantastic experience. It was fun for our little group to do on vacation. Warning: the doll room really is very creepy.

name: Brittney Owens
text:
We had a party of 7. When we arrived we were told it had accidentally been over booked and that we had to take a slot the next night. We showed up the next night and were told they overbooked us again. We were told we had to return for a different room after 11pm. We had young kids and couldn't do it. They refused to refund the money so we are now out $22 per person. I wouldn't recommend this place.

Response to the owner: when an employee tells us to pay for a portion of the party and the room will be reserved, it is a verbal contract. We were assured the whole room was reserved for our party.

resp.text: You need to pay for your slot, you cant just "hey , I might have 7 people coming later" ,if you tried to do that at a movie and the movie sold out, you wouldn't get to see the movie! We were even nice enough to stay open late and let you do a room then but refused.

name: Justin Lovvorn
text: It was challenging but some of the clues were not obtainable due to poor label/coloring.

name: Lynette Dunston
text:
This was very disappointing.
I will say the sign in and check in process was great which is why I am giving them 2 stars instead of 1. The young ladies were very friendly, knowledgeable and accomadating.
We chose to do the Doll Room. We walked in and was very impressed of the set up. They told us we first had to find 6 keys. So we hit the ground running. While we were searching for keys my husband was going through the dresser drawers pulling clues out. We found the 6 keys and quickly became confused as to where the locks were. We checked all the locked chests but they were all combo locks. After a few minutes we noticed the drawers my husband had been going through were supposed to be locked with the key locks. So someone forgot to prep the room properly. The next frustrating thing is it was dark and only a red light on in there, which is fine with the flashlights they have in the drawers, but 2 of the 3 flashlights were dying and were barely usable. And with the letters rubbing off the combo locks it made it hard to see them even with the little lights. We did need help with a clue, called through the walkie talkie....there was soo much noise outside our room I don't think the staff heard us. So I had to wait a few minutes before trying again. We finally made it to the last task and we struggled and never made it out in time. When we asked the girl how we were supposed to do it, it didn't make sense. She showed us these lines/arrows and how we're supposed to line them up, however, the lines on one of the cards does not line up at all. It is drawn on wrong. When we pointed it out, she just said "well, it's supposed to". Had they actually lined up maybe we might have made it out, who knows. But when I'm paying $26 a person to do this room, the clues should be legit and not half assed. I was also disappointed to find out they're supposed to take your picture of your group whether or not we made it out. She never offered. I would not waste your time or money with them.

Updating to edit we were at the Destin location.

resp.text: Which location did you do the room. All the things you describe is due to poor Game Master not doing there job correctly. Once you give me this information I will definitely be getting with the manager on all these issues.

name: Wyatt Fenner
text: That was awesome! I would love to do all of them but we are leaving tomorrow, definitely worth it if you like challenging puzzles.

name: Andrew Poole

name: Jacob Schorr
text: Fun experience. We did the zombie room, was pretty challenging.

name: Linda Thomas
text: Very pleasant staff and delightful wares, standard souvenir items and more!

name: James
text:
Back for a 3rd, ok 4th time because we had fun originally.  These times were different.  The first experience resulted in us being booked over due to being told the wrong information on the phone (1140 at night).  We were booked for the following night at 930 and told to pay for 3 but wed be blocked out for 10.  When we showed up tonight, same story.  We tried to stand our ground and get our slot (again even the employees recognized their mistake) and eventually the owner was called.

I was handed the phone and politely introduced myself and tried to explain our two night issue and was told "shush im gonna explain this to you".  (Worth noting this was Brad Egly not the other owner whom I had a great conversation with)  He continued to "explain" all his company policies I didn't follow regarding booking procedures as if I was his employee. (He was yelling, people across the room could hear him and he wasn't on speaker)  I waited my turn and asked what I did wrong trusting his employee was telling me accurate statements to which he got even more upset with me.  I put their phone down at this point and bounced around a little full of adrenaline and I apologize if the tenseness I felt translated to a raised voice with the employees not hiding behind a phone.  (Those employees were great btw, no idea how they can work for him.  Seriously, put in for an HR or counselor position with any other company and under experience just write his name, I'll vouch.)

Anyway, those employees did what they could but the owner topped things off with saying no refund.  So Brad can deal with my bank and hopefully this review will keep you from having to deal with Brad.

Quick Edit: Brad earned the 1 star, the experience was lame but wouldn't be worth sharing.

Response to the owner: We were told we had the room at that time by your employee.  She booked it and we paid for our family with the understanding we could pay for the rest later (once again Im not your employee and not required to know your internal policies).  Maybe you should take responsibility for the fact that YOU (Brad) deleted our reservation without asking a simple question of where the other payments were.  You need to amend your system to require payment before booking or provide pop up warnings to prompt your staff on your policies.  Most of all, don't yell at a paying customer.  I mean why would you get so worked up when everyone at the establishment was speaking calmly to each other?  Your hiding at home, your staff has to deal with the person face to face.  Not everyone would take what I took near as well.

resp.text: It's real simple, if you pay for 3 spots , you get 3 spots! If you don't pay for the spot you cant just show up with a random number of people and ask to have them come in the room with you.

name: LaToya Coleman
text: Went here one Friday night a few months ago.  At the time this escape room recently opened up about 1 month ago.   They have 3 available rooms to persue.  We did the zombie room.  The owner and workers were really nice and informative.   The room had the standard rules that most escape rooms had:  1 hr to escape, walkie talkie to use for clues, a key and button to press in the room if you had to escape emergently.  The room we did was divided into 2 rooms.  The first room was a little cramped to fit 8 ppl.  The clues were easy to medium to figure out.  The 2nd room took a little more thinking.  The design and stylizing of the place was low key in comparison to the other escape rooms I've been too.  Not as stylish and modern in decor as the other places I've been to.  Still a fun night out

We are visiting from out of town and thought this would be a cool experience for our gymnastics team! Our party of 16 arrived and about half of that consisted of little kids (10 & under). We were all so excited (maybe even too excited) and ERT did NOT disappoint! The crew (Jacob, Macy, & Juliana) were so patient with us checking in and even gave us a heads up about which room would be too scary for the little ones. I’m so glad they did that!!! The rooms are incredibly well thought out and super fun for all ages. I honestly don’t think we could have even come close to escaping without the clues from the crew. You guys are awesome and our whole party is still raving about how much fun it was!!!
If you’re in Tuscaloosa, PLEASE DO NOT SKIP THIS!! You will be sorry if you do!!! SO MUCH FUN!!! Can’t wait to visit again!!

text: I played the cabin escape game and it was pretty fun, my only complaint is that one of the clues was unclear but other than that it was awesome!

name: Andy Free
text: I recently visited Escape Tuscaloosa with three of my friends to do the Prison escape room. We arrived about thirty minutes early and the staff was accommodating and kind, directing us towards any amenities we might need. The room itself was one of the most fun I have been through. The puzzles were fun and unlike anything your have seen before in an escape room. We had a wonderful bonding experience and made it out with four minutes to spare. Thank you to the whole staff for their incredible service. And don’t forget to visit Escape Tuscaloosa!!

It was an adventure, exciting. It was much better than I expected
Went as a group of coworkers and we competed in groups it was fun

name: Jasmyne “FatGirlish” bay
text: An awesome experience! Greeted and assisted by a super sweet and informative young lady! This was our first breakout room and she was so patient explaining everything! The cabin was veryyyyy tricky but so fun! I can’t wait to go back!

name: Julie Janson
text:
We started off our Tuscaloosa escape adventure with Escape Tuscaloosa and what a wonderful place to begin it was! We give this venue 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 for high production value, friendly and accommodating staff, excellent puzzle design, and look and location of facilities.

We arrived early as walk-ins and were immediately greeted by friendly and accommodating Chad who, with his equally awesome associate Aly, booked us for all four rooms with just the two of us competing.

We were able to do all four rooms in a row, with a short break for some refueling at Edgar’s delicious bakery next door (serving not only baked good but light lunches), recommended by the staff.

Our favorite rooms, in order, were The Cabin, The Prison, The Playbook, and The Casino. ALL were great rooms, but we had the most fun in the creepy cabin and also creepy but slightly humorous prison. Alabama State fans: Don’t miss The Playbook where you can bask in crimson glory (if you are over 6’ tall, beware of lasers). The Casino is a perfectly good room, just a little high-tech for our liking (it was also the only room we didn’t escape, so... there’s that grudge!)

Escape Score: 3/4 rooms escaped

So far this is a Top 3 facility and we highly recommend!

-Mr. & Mrs. Escapology

name: Brandy Wickliffe
text:
My family has been going to Trussville Urban Air since they opened and as a surprise for my sons 8th birthday we booked him a party on 12/4. I am absolutely appalled at the staffing of this establishment. My son and his friend (both 10) were physically assaulted by a group of teenagers (15). Now I know, kids can be wild but I had several adults that I didnt know run to find me when this happened. My older nephew attempted to intervene as these children were stomping on my sons stomach and forcibly holding him under the ball pit. I was informed by multiple adult witnesses who confirmed this was in fact what was happening. When my nephew tried to tell the boys to leave my 10 year old son alone the boys ADULT father bowed up on my nephew making threats yelling in his face. My nephew is also A CHILD. There were ZERO staff members to be found and when I was finally able to talk to a manager (Tiffany) I was disrespected and cut off mid sentence. She refused to hear my concerns. I was completely rational and calm as I was just trying to speak with someone in charge and have the cameras viewed so I could find out what actions should be taken. When asked to speak to someone above her she refused to give me any name or contact info and WALKED AWAY mid sentence. We have always enjoyed bringing our children here, but if I am paying for a party that large with that many children I would expect my guests to be SAFE. I would love to speak with someone above the managers on staff due to the absolute lack of professionalism they displayed. It is not my intention to be tacky or tasteless but I am shocked at how children being visibly injured was met by "management". This establishment should be well staffed for the level of children it sees on a nightly basis and all of the children should feel and BE safe. Staff members do not supervise in any way, like other trampoline parks do. spending close to 500$ for a 2 hour party, my child and his friend were jumped on kicked and bullied by 5 teenage boys and the manager (Tiffany) didn't even offer an apology or ask the children if they were okay.. nothing. My experience was awful. Tiffany would not hear my concerns, would not review the cameras and let me know the severity of the situation. Due to this, 5 kids left my sons party and I was left feeling a HUGE lack of customer service. The chosen manager of this establishment should put children first, listen to the concerns of paying patrons and have solutions. She was the most disrespectful manager I have ever met. I had my  son and his friend upset right in front of her and she barely looked at them, didn't ask if they were okay. She walked away.

after reaching out to an owner, I was not offered any resolution or an offer of looking at the camera. Simply "I'll speak to tiffany about this" and s"orry this happened". finally got the apology that should have happened days before but too little too late. what resolution would you expect if this happened at a party you were hosting and it was your children being hurt?

great leadership comes from the top. get it together. while I know these specific incidents are isolated, you should know how to handle these situations and so should your staff. view  the cameras, even if the patron cannot. have a resolution.

name: Lesa Roush
text:
**Edited to ad more review** party booked for 11-1 said I could arrive 15mins prior for set up yet they don't open their doors till 11, they also fail to disclosethat the premium activities I paid for for the older kids don'topen till noon, when I booked 11-1, kids only got an hour to play on the rock wall, zip line and ceiling corse** very disappointed, will probably not book anymore parties here in the future.

Very fun but for the price you pay which is high, they shouldn't limit it to 2hrs or lower the price to reflect the 2hr limit. Also the employees should not be sitting around talking bad about other employees where customers can hear them. Very unprofessional. Have a party booked and even though I booked online and placed the pizza order they still require you to call the Thursday before your party and you can never get anyone to answer the phone, so I left messages that have gone unanswered and her party is tomorrow. Hopefully they got my message and the pizzas will be ready. Very disappointed so far with the service.

we attended a 12 yr old's birthday party here and it was great! There are so many things to do that even when they were super crowded and busy there was always something to do. There's a mini obstacle course over a ball pit. There are various trampoline areas designated for jumping. dodgeball, basketball etc.  a balance beam over a foam pit for kids battling to knock each other off..There are areas that are for small children only as well.   there are massage chairs spread out about a place for the parents to sit in if you put money in for a massage. (Don't get carried away .. No matter how much you enjoy it... If you do more than 20minutes, your body is probably going to be sore the next day or two) for a little extra money there is also a rock climbing wall and a zip line that will send you across the building to one side and then whip you around back to where you started from instead of just going straight across so that was really cool. There's an area where you can be tethered above for safety but being able to walk across small platforms or climb across a web of rope... they're just a lot of things to do. I saw the children of all ages they're having a good time. ( my 15 yr old going through one of those phases where nothing entertains him... Actually had his face light up .. so I paid for him to play outside of the party.
It can be a bit expensive covering the person and then buying their special socks required.. but the kids really did enjoy it so it's worth it.

We were there last year when first opened and it was super nice! Plenty of workers and smiling faces, yesterday was a completely different experience, it seemed like kids running the place were  more worried about what they looked like then doing their job!! Over crowded!! Will not be returning.....also too many people sitting in the massage chairs taking up space while they are beeping the ENTIRE time!! Very very annoying!!!! We were there over two hours and it was the SAME people that never moved from them!!!!!

text:
The Pros:

Lots of things for a 6 year old to do for hours.

Reasonably priced for what it is.

Food is good.

Facility was clean and in good shape.

The Cons:

One of the main attractions “The Ropes” was not working and no discount was made to reflect this for the ultimate package.

The entire staff looked like they hate life. They play amongst themselves and give very little attention to the children. Parents had to whistle and wave down staff to unhook their kids at the rock wall area because the staff were too busy huddled up together talking. When they were actually doing their job, they all had sad faces like they had been yelled at for something 5 minutes ago.

Please retrain your staff.

name: Kim James
text:
Please do not let your kids ride in the air here!! Please do not enter the building while anyone is in the air!!!!!

PLEASE DO NOT LET YOUR KIDS RIDE ANY OF THE AIR ATTRACTIONS HERE WITHOUT BEING ADVISED THAT AN AIR ROPES COURSE RIDER WHO APPEARED TO BE STILL STRAPPED IN THE HARNESS FELL SEVERAL FEET JUST LAST FRIDAY 3/29/19, AND THE COMMUNITY IS NOT AWARE OF THIS.  Don't let it be your kid please!  PEOPLE SITTING DOWN ON THE GROUND BELOW WERE ALSO HARMED!!!!

This is important!! I'll repeat it.  If you plan to go and play it safe by not riding in the air, then this review is still for you and all of your family  because PEOPLE SITTING DOWN ON THE GROUND BELOW WERE ALSO HARMED!!!!

Please read on or call to try to find out for yourself before you go.  I don't want it to happen again to anyone!!  I've tried many times for a week now, but I can't reach any local or corporate officials with Urban Air to explain or calm our fears.  Who checks on these things?  Who answers to every parent that takes their kids to Urban Air?
It's Friday again and I'm trying not to scream at the thought that Urban Air Trampoline and Adventure Park in Trussville is still open (as far as I know) and still not answering any real questions about last Friday's horrific experience.   This wasn't your average bounce on the trampoline and break an ankle thing. This was a HORRIBLE NIGHTMARE that really happened to innocent people.   Urban Air, what's preventing it from happening again?

How do you drop a person from the sky?  Why did you drop her on top of a mom who was simply sitting on a bench below? It Was Horrible!!! There is so much more to say, but graphic details are not appropriate or important here.

I don't know if the other visitors there on Friday are just still too shaken up to talk about it.  Or just so relieved like us that their kid didn't fall.  Or maybe like me they hate to write online reviews (especially bad ones).  Well I would give Urban Air Trampoline Adventure Park in Trussville, Alabama negative 5 stars if I could, but I can't, so 1 horrible star.  Our little one has had a difficult time since he saw that horrible event on his last outing for Spring Break.  Thank goodness, he made it out ok.  Still, I'm so very sorry we chose  the Trussville Urban Air, but we knew other kids who enjoyed it there in the past.  I'm sorry to say we even teased a teenager who was too scared to ride, but he was wiser than us I guess.  We researched. We read the google reviews first. Obviously, not enough people write reviews.  We thought it was safe (trampoline park safe anyway).  We were wrong!   It's not even safe to sit on the benches and watch your babies.  And the lack of customer followup and consideration just adds to the mess.

Because of the layout of this Urban Air in Trussville, people on the ground are always under one of the air rides!  There should be a safety net or some type of separate area to keep kids above and kids and families below safe!!!!!!  We've visited Homewood Urban Air without a big problem. (Of course they don't have the air rope course and racer).

PLEASE DON'T LET ANYONE YOU LOVE (OR HATE) SIT OR WALK AROUND ANYWHERE IN THIS URBAN AIR LOCATION WHEN SOMEONE IS RIDING ANY AIR ATTRACTION (even with a harness)!!!

I hope this helps someone.  If you saw this, please speak up too and let people know.  It's time.  I can't believe the news didn't cover this.  I wish someone else said it sooner than me.  Every customer who was there Friday deserves answers, although not nearly as much as the injured victims.  We hope and pray they are alive and OK.  Every potential customer deserves answers so that it doesn't happen again.

Urban Air in Trussville, I don't see how you are still open and promoting Birthday packages. But since you are, PLEASE PROTECT YOUR PATRONS( that includes kids riding and also includes moms and babies sitting and watching below)!!   I hope you are at least answering and helping the people you seriously hurt last Friday.

resp.text: Hi Kim,This is Carolyn from the Corporate office. I just read your review this morning (Saturday, April 6th). If you would like to provide a phone number or email address for me to contact you, I can speak to you about your concerns. You may contact me at reviews@urbanairparks.com. My kiddos play at Urban Air Parks frequently and I can assure you safety is at the heart of everything we do. The Trussville Park closed the attraction you mentioned for a thorough inspection. I’m around if you want to talk, we consider our guests an extension of our family.Sincerely,Carolyn McLeanreviews@urbanairparks.comUrban Air’s Corporate Office
